alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 06 at 5:12AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Areas of Fog, Locally Dense, Developing North of I-4... At 510 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras showed fog spreading across northern Lake and northwest Volusia Counties. Visibilities in some locations had dropped to less than one mile. Through sunrise, the fog is expected to continue spreading south across southern Lake County and the I-4 corridor from southwest Volusia County to greater Sanford, Orlando, and Kissimmee. The fog should burn off between 8 and 9 AM. Drivers in this area should prepare to encounter rapid reductions in visibility on their morning commute. Consider leaving early so that you can arrive safely at your destination as a safe driving speed. When driving in dense fog, slow down, use only your low beam headlights, and leave extra distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County
